title: First Ariane 5 flight of 2022 launches two satellites for Asia-Pacific
summary: Arianespace launched a pair of satellites aiming to improve broadband coverage in the Asia-Pacific region June 22 on the Ariane 5 rocket’s first flight of the year.

title: Second segment added to Starship launch tower at Kennedy Space Center
summary: The second section of the Florida launch tower for SpaceX’s huge Super Heavy and Starship rocket was lifted on top of the first tower segment Thursday at the Kennedy Space Center, continuing construction of a structure that will stand more than 400 feet tall.

title: Microsoft, Xplore and NOAA demonstrate cloud-based satellite operations
summary: Over the last year, Microsoft and Xplore worked with the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration to show how commercial services could support operations of polar-orbiting weather satellites.

title: Office of Space Commerce on a “listening tour” for civil space traffic management
summary: The new head of the Office of Space Commerce says he’s talking with industry on how his office can best take over civil space traffic management while also potentially taking on more regulatory responsibilities.

title: SpaceX’s record-breaking Falcon 9 booster returns to port
summary: SpaceX’s latest record-breaking Falcon 9 booster has returned to port after completing its 13th launch and landing. Falcon 9 B1060 lifted off...

title: House Armed Services Committee advances 2023 NDAA, increases DoD spending by $37 billion
summary: The committee approved an amendment by Rep. Jared Golden (D-Maine) to increase the defense budget by $37 billion

title: Velo3D makes in-kind investment in Plasmos
summary: Propulsion startup Plasmos is testing its first rocket engine thanks to a $250,000 in-kind investment from Velo3D, a metal additive manufacturing startup.

title: NASA Administrator Announces Next NAC Meeting, New Members
summary: NASA Administrator Bill Nelson announced Wednesday the NASA Advisory Council (NAC) will convene its next meeting on August 9-10. Nelson also appointed new members to the NAC, who will provide leadership counsel and advice on agency programs and priorities.

title: NASA Awards Contracts for Mission Enabling Services
summary: NASA has awarded the Mission Enabling Services Contract (MESC), which consists of five individual contracts, to four companies to support highly specialized mission-enabling spaceflight and aircraft management services within the Flight Operations Directorate at the agency’s Johnson Space Center in Houston.

title: NASA moves up Lunar Trailblazer launch
summary: NASA has found a new ride for a small lunar orbiter mission that will allow the spacecraft to avoid a two-year wait for its launch.
